chapters.title: The Fallen Man
chapters.summary: Disgraced virologist Dr. Aris Thorne, working a dead-end job, is approached by a representative of the secretive biotech firm, Prometheus Solutions, with an offer he cannot refuse.
key_events: Aris is shown publicly shamed in a flashback to a research scandal.
He lives in a sparse apartment, haunted by his past.
Elara Vance, a poised operative from Prometheus, offers him a lead role on a 'groundbreaking project'.
The offer includes full restoration of his credentials and unlimited resources.
Aris, desperate for redemption, accepts.
chapters.ending_hook: Aris signs a dense non-disclosure agreement and is whisked away to a remote, state-of-the-art facility known only as 'The Hive'.

chapters.title: The Hive
chapters.summary: Aris arrives at the clandestine Prometheus facility and is introduced to the Lazarus Project: a therapy to resurrect the recently deceased by repairing cellular damage and neural patterns.
key_events: Aris meets the project's director, the charismatic but intense Dr. Silas Reeves.
He is shown the core technology: a viral vector (the Lazarus Strain) that can rewrite cellular death pathways.
The first human subject is revealed: Subject Alpha, a John Doe from a local morgue.
Aris's expertise in viral manipulation is deemed crucial for stabilizing the strain.
He feels a mix of awe and deep ethical unease.
chapters.ending_hook: During a late-night lab session, Aris notices the subject's intake file has been heavily redacted, except for one detail—a unique tribal tattoo on his forearm.

chapters.title: Breath of Life
chapters.summary: The team initiates the resurrection sequence on Subject Alpha. The process is a staggering, chaotic success.
key_events: The Lazarus Strain is administered to Subject Alpha's body.
The team watches as cellular functions restart in a violent, unpredictable cascade.
Subject Alpha's eyes snap open, and he goes into violent seizures.
Against all odds, he stabilizes, showing full brain activity.
Aris is the first to speak to him as he regains consciousness.
chapters.ending_hook: Subject Alpha grips Aris's arm, looks him dead in the eye, and whispers, 'Silas Renner killed me.' Silas Renner is the billionaire founder of Prometheus Solutions.

chapters.title: The Accusation
chapters.summary: Aris confronts the project leadership with Alpha's claim, only to be met with gaslighting and accusations of instability.
key_events: Aris reports the accusation to Dr. Reeves, who dismisses it as 'neural echo' or post-resurrection psychosis.
Security footage of the awakening is reviewed, but Alpha's whisper is inaudible.
Renner himself appears via secure video link, calmly denying ever knowing Alpha and praising Aris's work.
Aris is ordered to focus on stabilizing Alpha's physiology, not his 'delusions'.
Alpha, now called 'Lazarus', is sedated for 'observation'.
chapters.ending_hook: While checking Lazarus's vitals, Aris finds a tiny, scarred-over microchip embedded near the tattoo—a subdermal tracker he wasn't told about.

chapters.title: Ghost in the Machine
chapters.summary: Aris begins a clandestine investigation, using his access to dig into Lazarus's true identity and the origins of the Lazarus Strain.
key_events: Aris bypasses firewalls to find Lazarus's unredacted file: his name is Leo Vance, a former investigative journalist.
He discovers Leo was reporting on Prometheus's illegal biological weapons research three years ago before his 'accidental' death.
Aris uncovers hidden lab logs showing the Lazarus Strain was derived from a highly volatile, weaponized pathogen called 'Thanatos'.
Elara Vance, his point of contact, is revealed to be Leo's sister, unaware of his true fate.
Aris realizes the resurrection was not a trial, but a cover-up that went wrong.
chapters.ending_hook: Aris's unauthorized access is detected. Alarms blare as security seals the sector he's in.

chapters.title: Containment Breach
chapters.summary: A security lockdown traps Aris in the lab just as a critical flaw is revealed: the Lazarus Strain is airborne and mutating in Subject Alpha's body.
key_events: The lockdown is blamed on a 'drill', but Aris knows he's the target.
Biological alarms trigger—Subject Alpha is shedding viral particles.
The strain is evolving, becoming transmissible and destabilizing the resurrected tissue.
Aris works frantically to contain the leak within the lab's isolation unit.
He makes contact with Elara, revealing the truth about her brother.
chapters.ending_hook: Aris contains the immediate leak, but security overrides his lab door. Dr. Reeves enters, not with guards, but with a syringe, telling Aris he's 'too valuable to lose, but too dangerous to trust'.

chapters.title: A Deal with the Devil
chapters.summary: Sedated and restrained, Aris is given an ultimatum by Silas Renner himself: perfect the strain and ensure its commercial future, or be permanently silenced.
key_events: Aris wakes in a luxurious but secure quarters, a gilded cage.
Renner explains his vision: conquering death, with the 'unfortunate side effects' to be managed.
Leo's resurrection is framed as an 'accounting error' that needs correcting.
Renner offers Aris fame, fortune, and a seat at the right hand of a god.
Aris appears to agree, buying time to plan.
chapters.ending_hook: Given limited lab access to begin 'stabilization', Aris secretly codes a kill-switch sequence into the strain's core genome, a digital poison pill.

chapters.title: Lazarus Rising
chapters.summary: Leo, growing stronger and more unstable, breaks free of his confinement with help from Elara, who has turned against Prometheus.
key_events: Elara uses her security clearance to access Leo's isolation chamber.
Leo's memories are fully integrated, and his body exhibits alarming strength and regenerative ability—side effects of the mutating strain.
He and Elara have a tearful, frantic reunion.
They create a diversion, causing a power surge in a secondary lab.
Their goal: find Aris and get the truth to the outside world.
chapters.ending_hook: As they flee through a service duct, they look down into a central atrium and see Renner and Reeves overseeing the preparation of a second subject—a prominent, recently deceased politician.

chapters.title: The Thanatos Protocol
chapters.summary: Aris discovers Prometheus's true endgame: not resurrection for all, but selective immortality for the elite, with the volatile strain as a doomsday weapon against dissent.
key_events: Aris gains access to the project's black budget files: 'The Thanatos Protocol'.
The protocol outlines using the airborne, mutated strain as a targeted bioweapon that can induce rapid, selective decay.
Plans for a 'demonstration' on a dissident nation are uncovered.
Renner intends to sell both immortality and annihilation.
Aris copies the data onto a secure drive.
chapters.ending_hook: Reeves confronts Aris in the server room. A fight ensues, ending with Reeves accidentally exposed to a concentrated aerosol sample of the mutating strain.

chapters.title: The Vector
chapters.summary: Dr. Reeves transforms into the first voluntary, psychotic carrier of the perfected weaponized strain, becoming 'Patient Zero' inside the Hive.
key_events: Reeves undergoes rapid, horrific physical changes, his body warping but not dying.
He becomes violently aggressive, spreading the pathogen through the ventilation system.
Full-scale biocontainment breach is declared.
Aris, Leo, and Elara are forced to work together to navigate the chaotic, infected facility.
They must reach the central broadcast antenna to send the data out.
chapters.ending_hook: Renner, in a panic, initiates a facility self-destruct sequence to erase all evidence, trapping everyone inside with the evolving pathogen.

chapters.title: The Choice
chapters.summary: The trio races against the meltdown and the spreading pathogen. Leo's body begins to terminally destabilize—he is the living epicenter of the outbreak.
key_events: They fight through infected security personnel and failing systems.
Leo confesses he can feel the strain consuming him; he is a walking time bomb.
Aris reveals the digital kill-switch he engineered, but deploying it would require a massive viral upload from the central terminal, which would also kill Leo.
Elara must choose between saving her brother and potentially saving millions.
Leo makes the choice for her, heading to the terminal to sacrifice himself.
chapters.ending_hook: As Leo initiates the kill-switch upload, Renner appears, holding Elara at gunpoint, demanding the sequence be reversed.

chapters.title: Resurrection's End
chapters.summary: In a final confrontation, Aris must outsmart Renner while the facility collapses around them. The fate of the Lazarus Strain hangs in the balance.
key_events: Aris distracts Renner, allowing Elara to break free.
Leo, deteriorating rapidly, tackles Renner, buying Aris the final seconds to lock in the kill-switch command.
A global signal is sent, broadcasting the Thanatos Protocol data and deactivating the core strain genome.
The pathogen inside every carrier (including Reeves) begins to denature and die.
Renner is left trapped in the collapsing facility as Aris and Elara escape to an evacuation point.
chapters.ending_hook: Weeks later, Aris and Elara testify before a closed congressional hearing. As they leave, a man in a black car hands Aris a blank card with a single symbol on it—the logo of another shadowy organization—suggesting the knowledge of resurrection is now forever in the world, waiting for the next hand to wield it.
